result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malcolm J Griffin appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Malcolm J Griffin.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-23-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malcolm J Griffin appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Malcolm J Griffin.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are requesting a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 9:00 am for a DPA hearing by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Malcolm J Griffin in court with attorney Steve Sargent on behalf of William Anthony Rakestraw.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference to Br 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malcolm J Griffin in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or scheduling; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

11:35 AM Defendant Malcolm J Griffin in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Malcolm J Griffin in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
